subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Tuesday, 15 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Newcastle name Allardyce as boss
Newcastle appoint Sam Allardyce as their new manager on a three-year deal.



 
Fifa chief wades into Tevez saga
Fifa president Sepp Blatter will look into how the Premier League handled West Ham's breach of rules over Carlos Tevez and Javier Mascherano.



 
Neville ruled out of FA Cup final
Man Utd confirm captain Gary Neville will not recover from an ankle injury in time to play in Saturday's FA Cup final.








GOLF




Clarke withdraws from Irish Open
Darren Clarke is forced to pull out of this week's Irish Open because of injury.



 
Mickelson earns Sawgrass victory
Phil Mickelson wins The Players Championship by two strokes from Sergio Garcia.



 
Hudson pleased despite collapse
England's Rebecca Hudson is happy to move a step closer to a place at the British Open despite throwing away victory at the Spanish Open.








MOTORSPORT




Hamilton will set 'new standards'
Lewis Hamilton will "create the new benchmark for Formula One", according to three-time champion Jackie Stewart.



 
Spaniard Pons to drive for Subaru
Spain's Xevi Pons will compete for Subaru in the World Rally Championship for the second half of the season and the whole of 2008.



 
Alonso plays down Hamilton threat
Fernando Alonso says he does not regard McLaren team-mate Lewis Hamilton as his biggest threat this season.








FORMULA ONE




Hamilton will set 'new standards'
Lewis Hamilton will "create the new benchmark for Formula One", according to three-time champion Jackie Stewart.



 
Alonso plays down Hamilton threat
Fernando Alonso says he does not regard McLaren team-mate Lewis Hamilton as his biggest threat this season.



 
Ferrari concerned by reliability
Ferrari boss Jean Todt fears lack of reliability may undermine his team's dual title challenge this year.








ATHLETICS




Kenya star denied Manchester visa
World half-marathon record holder Sammy Wanjiru will miss Sunday's Great Manchester Run after failing to obtain a visa.



 
Sprint stars set for Loughborough
Three of the British squad that won the Olympic 4x100m gold in 2004 will compete at the Loughborough International on Sunday.



 
Cheruiyot storms to Glasgow win
Vivian Cheruiyot wins the women's 10 kilometres road race in Glasgow.








CYCLING




Landis lawyer blasts testing lab
Floyd Landis' lawyer says the laboratory used for his dope tests failed to meet international standards.



 
Petacchi hits back with stage win
Alessandro Petacchi wins the third stage of the Giro d'Italia while compatriot Enrico Gasparotto regains the overall lead.



 
Hoy sets new world best over 500m
Chris Hoy misses out on the kilometre world record in Bolivia but sets a new mark over 500m.








FUN AND GAMES




Quotes of the Week
Jose Mourinho reacts to the news that Graham Poll may retire, plus chants



 
Comment: Rough justice for Blades
Robbo says West Ham should have been relegated 



 
Review of the week
Freddy Shepherd offers to "carry Michael Owen to Liverpool"
